file_content.text: Everyone's got to do their part.
What, is taking that ring to the old man too complicated for you? Get moving!
Haven't you caused enough trouble here?
Come on, get her in here on the double. We don't have all day.
I already told you! I don't know anything--I swear!
Sure, that's what you said the last time we talked. But now I'm thinking maybe you just didn't have enough incentive to tell the truth.
Hey! What are you doing here? You're not allowed in here! This is a top secret operation!
What's all this?
None of your business, buddy. Move along.
I was looking for a kidnapped girl. I won't intrude again.
Sorry.
Top secret, eh? Illegal, more like.
This doesn't look legitimate.
You should talk, scum, considering the sort of things your kind does. We serve the Republic.
He's lying! They've kidnapped us. They're torturing us!
You soldiers didn't happen to attack a merchant, did you?
I'm investigating a beating.
My father sent you, didn't he? Thank you!
Shut up!
Aaaaah! Please, you have to stop them! They're torturing us!
I said shut up! She's a traitor to the Republic. She deserves what she gets.
But the courts are full, you see, and so justice needs a little help. If that means Republic soldiers have to twist a few arms, so be it.
You seem awfully certain.
We do whatever we can to protect the Republic.
I agree.
That's what I like to hear. You want to help us help the Republic? Here's what you do.
Look, I was hired to bring back this man's daughter.
I don't care.
No, you look. I don't care who hired you.
That's ridiculous.
Torture is a legitimate tool of warfare. Do you think the separatists won't use it? Do you think the Empire won't use it?
These wretches have been caught, every last one of them, doing work for the separatists. They are traitors, and more importantly, they have information on separatist movements.
All we're doing is coaxing it out of them--information that will save so many Republic and Mantellian lives. Who'll care how we got it?
I'll care, and I'll make sure your superior cares, too.
Me.
Bribe me.
Sure, I think we can spare some credits, but you have to do us a favor.
The Republic has more respect for its enemies than that.
We're better than this.
Look, we don't like having to do this--but what are our choices? Listen.
You take this ring back to this girl's daddy and tell him it's all you can find of his little girl. The ring's got a listening device in it.
We'll be able to gather all the evidence we need--without resorting to these unsavory means. Got it?
I'll return to the merchant and plant the bug.
Will do.
Good, I'm glad you see things our way.
How could you? This is why the separatists endure. You're cruel and corrupt and selfish!
How many times do I have to tell you to shut up, woman!
Urgh.
Pay no attention to her. And here, take some of the credits we found on these traitors--as a sign of our continued friendship.
I don't want your dirty money.
Save it.
I wouldn't call it dirty. I'd call it... a fair reward for risking our lives in service to the Republic. But suit yourself.
Money is good.
Just remember to do your part.
Just don't try me.
Yeah, yeah. Just stay out of our way.
Go ahead and take the girl back to her cell, boys. I think we've got a much better lead, now.
This charade of justice ends now.
Absolutely not.
Whoa, whoa, take it easy! The last thing we need in here is a shoot-out, all right?
You want the little traitor so bad, fine--take her. But the only people you're helping are the separatists.
Thank you. Thank you for freeing me. It--it was terrible.
How could I not?
Are you really with the separatists?
Tell me the truth.
No, no, we went to a couple of protests, attended a few meetings, but we never did anything. We certainly don't know anything.
Yeah, sure.
It's the truth! We had no idea speaking our minds would get us marked as traitors!
What they did was shameful.
I'm glad you see things my way.
Maybe you should keep your mouth shut from now on.
Watch what you say.
I can't do that. Change won't happen if people don't speak out. But I will be more careful--I promise.
Best go home to your father--and try to stay out of trouble.
It's over now.
Your father will want to see you're alright.
Go home to Odar.
Um, yes. I'll, uh, I'll call him by holo... let him know I'm okay, that you saved me.
It seems like it's nothing but corruption on Ord Mantell these days. Good to see you're an exception.
Pleased to serve.
And I'm just glad you were here. Thank you so much.
Be careful from now on.
Don't worry. I'll be careful. Thanks again, and goodbye.
Your father's waiting. He's badly injured, and very worried about you.
You'd better go home.
I know, I'm sorry. It's all my fault those soldiers beat him up.
I'll call him as soon as I can, but I need to recover my strength. The torture took more out of me than I expected.
But thank you. I'd be dead without you.
Nothing to see here, soldier. Go about your business.
This area is off-limits to civilians. That means you.
Nothing to see here, all right? Just keep moving.
